Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/MyHush/insight-api-hush/commit/ec695ad1bb162c014d467f3b8abb112dc772e04c

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am dealing with some weird bugs, and I need to brain dump in here to clarify what is going on, and maybe get some help from other intrepid adventurers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am writing regtests, in Python, for RPCs which take the minconf parameter (many)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: using methods that i used in cryptoconditions.py, things seem to work as they should, where confirmations are held at 1 until a block is notarized. when NetworkID=="regtest", we simulate dpow by making every 7th block notarized

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: existing dpowconfs tests rely on that in Hush, and work reliably

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so i am converting these to the KMD test suite, which seems to be gravy at first

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but then I am seeing non-deterministic failing tests

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my tests check for an exact number of confirmations, such "make sure that at block X the xtn Y has exactly Z confirmations"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is how I can test if dpowconfs+minconfs (which I call dpowminconfs) is working correctly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it seems to be a timing/race condition. The notarization DB is lagging behind the rest of the system, so sometimes my tests say the block is not notarized (hence changing the dpowconfs), when in reality, it is.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This may be "normal" behavior, and it just doesn't happen in Hush because the internals of Hush are only keeping track of notarization data for one coin. The internals of KMD have more code to handle accessing the notarization data for all AC's, which I am guessing slows it down enough for regtests to sometimes fail, because the RPCs in my tests run before the notarization data is fully updated

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/compare/jl777...letolabs:dpowminconfs?expand=1

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you choose the `jl777` branch as base, it will show the diff correctly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: silly github doesn't put that in a url param, so you can't specify a base branch in a shared URL

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are various ways to hack/fix this issue, and I am wondering which is "best"

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: `git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo -b jl777` üòâ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is the test file I am working on: https://github.com/letolabs/komodo/blob/dpowminconfs/qa/rpc-tests/dpowconfs.py

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am currently changing my tests to just check for proper notarized/not-notarized ( confs > 1 ), but if somebody can think of a way to test the exact number of confs, reliably, I would love to hear

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: so the "sticking point" is when you include notarized and not just raw confs, yes?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my tests try to verify that when using minconf > 1 in an RPC, it only returns notarized xtns

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my code changes do the default behavior if minconf=1, and use dpowconfs if minconf > 1
